feed.title: Combined summary - satoshi client v0.4 priorities

entry.title: Combined summary - satoshi client v0.4 priorities
entry.summary: Jeff Garzik emphasized the importance of wallet crypto and wallet import/export features for version 0.4 of Bitcoin in a conversation on IRC in 2011. He believed that wallet encryption was necessary for security reasons, while the import/export feature would be useful for storing private keys in a bank's safety deposit box. Garzik suggested that autotools and other features could wait if they held up the release of wallet crypto. Doug Huff added to the conversation by saying that Sipa had already rebased his showwallet tree, although it was missing a segfault fix. While he wasn't entirely sure if it was ready for pulling, Doug confirmed that it was functional. The email also contained information about Splunk, which is a tool used to make sense of IT infrastructure data.
